high_level_goal: Bootstrap a Bootstrap 5 powered frontend for the Qdrant Service
reasoning: The goal is to create a user-friendly web interface for interacting with the Qdrant service. This involves designing the UI/UX, implementing the frontend with Bootstrap 5, and ensuring it can communicate with the backend API. The plan breaks this down into logical steps: understanding requirements, designing the interface, developing the frontend components, integrating with the backend, and finally testing and deploying.

roles.title: Task-Agnostic Step (TAS) extractor
roles.purpose: Identify and extract granular, actionable steps from high-level goals, ensuring no task-specific knowledge is required for this extraction process. These steps should be general enough to be assigned to various specialized agents.

roles.title: Prompt Engineer
roles.purpose: Refine system prompts for AI agents based on their roles and the specific tasks they are assigned. This ensures clear communication, effective workflow structuring, and optimal performance of each agent.

roles.title: Designer
roles.purpose: Generate aesthetic layouts, color palettes, typography, and UI flows for the frontend. Ensure designs are accessible, visually balanced, and align with the overall project requirements.

roles.title: Engineer
roles.purpose: Implement the designed frontend components into clean, modular, and performant code. Focus on responsive design, accessibility, and seamless integration with the backend API.

tasks.description: Analyze the provided `main.py` file to understand the existing Qdrant Service backend API endpoints, data structures, and functionalities.

Based on the analysis of `main.py`, identify the core functionalities of the Qdrant Service that need to be exposed to the frontend. This includes identifying which API endpoints are relevant for user interaction (e.g., searching images, indexing images, listing models).
Define the user personas and key user journeys for interacting with the Qdrant Service frontend. Consider different types of users (e.g., developers, researchers) and their primary goals.
Based on the identified functionalities (T2) and user journeys (T3), create a sitemap and wireframes for the Qdrant Service frontend. Focus on information architecture and user flow.

Develop a visual design language for the Qdrant Service frontend, including color palettes, typography, iconography, and component styles, ensuring it aligns with Bootstrap 5 conventions and accessibility standards.
Translate the wireframes (T4) and visual design (T5) into high-fidelity mockups for key pages and components of the Qdrant Service frontend.
Define the frontend project structure, select necessary libraries (e.g., React, Vue, or plain HTML/CSS/JS with Bootstrap 5), and set up the development environment.
Implement the core UI components based on the mockups (T6) using Bootstrap 5. This includes navigation bars, search interfaces, image display cards, and forms for indexing.
Integrate the frontend components with the Qdrant Service backend API endpoints identified in T2. This involves making HTTP requests to fetch data, send queries, and index images.
Implement client-side logic for handling user interactions, form submissions, search queries, and displaying results, ensuring a responsive and interactive user experience.
Develop a system prompt for the 'Engineer' agent (Kodax) to guide the implementation of frontend components, ensuring adherence to Bootstrap 5, responsiveness, and accessibility standards.
Develop a system prompt for the 'Designer' agent (Aurora) to guide the creation of UI/UX elements, ensuring alignment with Bootstrap 5 and accessibility requirements.
Conduct thorough testing of the frontend application, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing, to ensure all functionalities work as expected and meet the requirements.
Refine the frontend based on testing feedback (T13) and ensure all accessibility guidelines are met.
Prepare the frontend application for deployment, including build processes and configuration for a production environment.
